TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In practical terms, this means primarily avoiding waste or reducing it to an absolute minimum.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: However, as resources are scarce and many raw materials are only available in limited quantities, the reuse of materials and raw materials in the form of secondary materials is becoming increasingly key for manufacturing processes going forward.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: For example, the growing popularity of electric mobility worldwide cannot be covered by primary materials alone in the long term.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Furthermore, there is a strong synergy between the conservation of primary natural resources and carbon dioxide emissions.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Therefore, from a sustainability perspective, the underlying flows of resources require some rethinking.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The BMW Group aims to obtain high-quality secondary materials through promoting a greater degree of transparency in the recycling chain and simultaneously tracing the reuse of (secondary) raw materials within the cycle.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Even today, vehicles are already required to be 95 % recyclable.

SENTENCE: However, the proportion of secondary raw materials used to manufacture new vehicles is still comparatively low.

SENTENCE: In view of this key point, the BMW Group plans to considerably increase this proportion in its vehicles by 2030 -and is already exploring some very far-reaching scenarios.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The use of secondary materials again significantly reduces carbon emissions in comparison to primary materials -by as much as 80 % in the case of aluminium, for example.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN

SENTENCE: In the case of critical raw materials, for example, any political conflicts in the producing countries could also give rise to risks for the BMW Group's procurement activities, which can be mitigated through the use of secondary products.

SENTENCE: This holistic BMW Group approach is intended to ensure that all available resources are used in a responsible manner.

SENTENCE: Responsible and lawful conduct is fundamental to the success of the BMW Group.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: -Board of Management decision of 15 December 2020 establishing a BMW Group Chief Compliance Officer, effective 1 January 2021, to further strengthen compliance management at the BMW Group.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: -Creation of six new compliance functions within the Board divisions of BMW AG, with a multi-day onboarding programme for the new Compliance Officers.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: -A company-wide tone-from-the-top communications initiative highlighting the compliance management culture at the BMW Group.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The BMW Group Policy "Antitrust Compliance", which establishes binding rules of conduct for all employees across the BMW Group to prevent unlawful restriction of competition, was supplemented by several additional manuals in 2020 and deserves particular mention.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The rules set out in the BMW Group Policy "Corruption Prevention" and the BMW Group Instruction "Corporate Hospitality and Gifts" deal with lawful handling of gifts and benefits and define appropriate assessment criteria and approval procedures.

SENTENCE: The BMW Group Instruction "Anti-money-Laundering" defines company-wide standards for anti-money-laundering for trade in goods and the financial services sector.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN

SENTENCE: These courses are also offered on an optional basis to all other employees.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: More than 42,800 managers and staff worldwide have so far received training in the basic principles of compliance, including the content of the Legal Compliance Code and the topic of corruption prevention, and hold a valid training certificate.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The company makes sure that newly recruited managers and promoted staff receive compliance training.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: One main emphasis here is on department-specific antitrust training -an area that was significantly expanded in 2020.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: GRI 205-2 Any member of staff with questions or concerns relating to compliance is expected to discuss these matters with their managers and with the relevant departments within the BMW Group: in particular, with the BMW Group Compliance Committee Office, Legal Affairs and Corporate Audit.

SENTENCE: The BMW Group also uses an IT-based Business Relations Compliance programme to ensure the reliability of its business relations.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Relevant business partners are checked and evaluated for potential compliance risks.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Appropriate measures are implemented to manage compliance risks based on the results of the evaluation.

SENTENCE: A further IT system is used to verify customer integrity as required under anti-money-laundering regulations.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: IT solutions for automated reporting of compliance training activities and documentation of all compliance activities conducted by the business units were also under development during the reporting year.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Through the Group-wide reporting system, compliance responsibles across all organisational units of the BMW Group report, on both an ongoing and adhoc basis, on the compliance status of their respective units, on any identified legal risks and incidences of non-compliance, as well as on sanctions and corrective / preventative measures implemented.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Compliance with and implementation of compliance rules and processes are audited regularly by Corporate Audit and subjected to control checks by the BMW Group Compliance Committee Office.

SENTENCE: Managers, in particular, bear a high degree of responsibility and must set a good example with regard to preventing infringements.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Managers must, at regular intervals and on their own initiative, verify compliance with the law.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: It is important to signal to employees that they take compliance risks seriously and that disclosing relevant information is extremely valuable.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: It is essential for compliance at the BMW Group that employees are aware of and comply with applicable legal regulations.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The BMW Group does not tolerate violations of the law.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Culpable violations of the law result in employment-contract sanctions and may involve personal liability consequences for the employee involved.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Compliance is also an important factor in safeguarding the future of the BMW Group workforce.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: With this in mind, the Board of Management and the national and international employee representative bodies of the BMW Group have agreed on a binding set of joint principles for lawful conduct.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Employee representatives are regularly involved in the process of refining compliance management within the BMW Group.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: BMW Group models for ensuring compliance with environmental and social standards throughout its value chain are based on various internationally recognised guidelines.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: This especially applies to the With the signing of the UN Global Compact by the Board of Management of BMW AG in 2001 and the "Joint Declaration on Human Rights and Working Conditions in the BMW Group", which was adopted in 2005 and updated in 2010, the BMW Group has committed to abide by internationally recognised human rights and, specifically, the ILO core labour standards.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The BMW Group Code on Human Rights and Working Conditions, which was published in 2018 to provide further clarification, was ratified by the Board of Management and employee representatives.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: This affirms the BMW Group's commitment to human rights and outlines how it promotes respect for human rights and, specifically, how it implements the ILO Core Labour Standards in its business operations worldwide.

SENTENCE: The Code was also part of the compliance communications initiative "Walk-the-Talk".

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: GRI 412-1 Specific human rights risks arise in the supply chain due to the collaborative, cross-border and continent-spanning nature of value creation processes in the automotive industry.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In addition to the company's international purchasing terms and conditions, BMW Group dealer and importer contracts also contain a clause on compliance and human rights.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Human rights obligations are also considered in choosing sites and in important investment decisions.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In order to meet increasing requirements in the area of human rights, the BMW Group discusses various legislative proposals at German and European level through associations and initiatives and participates in the Automotive Industry Dialogue as part of the German government's National Action Plan on Business and Human Rights.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The German Federal Ministry of Labour and Social Affairs featured a practical example from the BMW Group on its CSR website.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: As part of its leadership of the CSR / Human Rights Working Group of the German Institute for Compliance (DICO), various aspects of human rights management in companies were discussed among members and presented at the DICO Forum in October 2020.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: A constant striving for innovation, for something new and better, is a concept deeply anchored in the corporate culture of the BMW Group -in the thinking of its employees, in its processes and also in the identity of its brands.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The benchmark and the goal of the BMW Group's activities is to identify the wishes of customers worldwide in advance, in order to actively help shape trends and thereby drive transformation -a strategy discerniable in production vehicles such as the BMW iX *.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In its development work, the BMW Group focuses on two key areas.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Firstly, innovative digital solutions that make people's everyday lives easier and at the same time protect the environment, and secondly, as a premium provider in its industry, the Group sees it as an obligation to offer customers a diverse range of customised, efficient drivetrain technologies ranging from all-electric drive systems, to plug-in hybrids and highly efficient internal combustion engines.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: This also includes hydrogen fuel cell technology, which the Group believes could become an additional option in the long term.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The BMW Group's culture of innovation is most deeply rooted in its global research and development network.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: However, innovation is a lot more than that for the BMW Group: throughout the entire company it is both the basis and the driving force behind the quest to replace the good with the better.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Innovative solutions benefit society in a number of ways: economically, ecologically and socially.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The dynamics of the markets in which the BMW Group operates are largely determined by customer expectations and therefore by demand.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The BMW Group therefore focuses on the wishes and needs of its customers.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Market expectations have a direct impact on the range of vehicles on offer.

SENTENCE: How big does the vehicle need to be?

SENTENCE: Which drivetrain variant fits your own lifestyle?

SENTENCE: For this reason, the BMW Group offers a broad range of drivetrain systems and aims to offer corresponding electrified models for all of its brands and for every series.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Ultimately, a business model is successful and sustainable in the long term by offering tailor-made solutions and assuring customers who are confident in their purchasing decisions.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: THE FIFTH GENERATION OF ELECTRIC DRIVETRAINS:

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: A MAJOR LEAP IN TERMS OF PRODUCTION AND SUSTAINABILITY

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Customer-oriented innovations frequently begin with basic research.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Built up over many years, the BMW Group's expertise makes sustainable solutions possible.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The new, in-house-developed electric motor does not contain any rare earth elements.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The latest generation of batteries requires two-thirds less cobalt than its predecessors.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The BMW Group also considers the factor of sustainability when sourcing the cobalt it uses.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The metal is acquired transparently via a certified process and supplied to the battery cell producers for further processing.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Details are available in the chapter Purchasing and Supplier Network Purchasing and Supplier Network.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The BMW Group has contractually agreed with the battery cell suppliers for the fifth generation of its eDrive electric drivetrain that only green electricity from renewable sources will be used in their production processes, which should reduce carbon emissions by some ten million tonnes over the next ten years.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In this fifth generation of the BMW Group's electric drivetrain, the electric motor, transmission and power electronics are also installed within a compact space.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The outstanding efficiency of the drivetrain components and the high energy density of the high-voltage battery enable ranges that conventional electric vehicles can only achieve with significantly larger and correspondingly heavier batteries and therefore lower efficiency.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: This electric drivetrain was deployed for the first time in the BMW iX3 *, which was launched in 2020.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: From 2021 onwards, further all-electric models such as the BMW iX * or the BMW i4 will be powered by this state-of-the-art technology.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: THE BMW GROUP COVERS THE ENTIRE PROCESS CHAIN FOR ELECTRIC DRIVETRAINS

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Whether electric motors, high-voltage batteries, charging equipment or power electronics -since 2011 the BMW Group has gained extensive experience with all the components used in eDrive technology and places its emphasis on in-house developments.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: By the end of 2022, all German vehicle plants will produce at least one fully electric vehicle.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The production system is capable of manufacturing vehicles either with internal combustion engines or electric drivetrains on a single line and can therefore also respond flexibly in terms of the type of drivetrain required by the customer.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: This level of flexibility in production allows the BMW Group to meet customer expectations in an ideal way.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: At the BMW Group's Battery Research Centre, work on battery cells is currently focusing on features that provide a high degree of customer value, including energy density, peak power, longevity, charging properties, costs, behaviour at various temperatures and, last but not least, safety.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: At the same time, the BMW Group is building a pilot plant for lithium-ion battery cells near Munich, making the BMW Group the first automotive manufacturer to singlehandedly cover the entire process chain of electric driving and master it in technological terms.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The BMW Group is also investing in the enhanced development of hydrogen fuel cell technology.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The BMW i Hydrogen NEXT, which is based on the X5, already awakened a great deal of interest among visitors at the IAA 2019.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In the long term, hydrogen technology could become a further component in the BMW Group's drivetrain range.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: If the supply of renewably produced hydrogen can be ensured, this technology will provide an attractive option for combining emissions-free mobility with long-distance capability and short refuelling times.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The BMW Group is convinced that different forms of drivetrain will continue to exist side by side in the future, as customer expectations cannot be met with a single solution on an international basis.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Beginning in 2022, the BMW Group will present a low-volume series of the BMW i Hydrogen NEXT featuring the second generation of its hydrogen fuel cell drive system.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: To make this aim a reality, the BMW Group has been collaborating successfully with Toyota Motor Corporation since 2013.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The new drivetrain technology will be combined with the fifth generation of the eDrive, which will then generate its energy from a fuel cell instead of a high-voltage battery.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The BMW Group has also developed this technology in-house as an overall system.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: However, the appropriate political and infrastructural framework conditions first need to be created if green hydrogen is to become widely available in sufficient quantities and at competitive prices.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Hydrogen can also play a key role in powering heavy-duty and commercial vehicles with the aim of making logistics carbon-neutral going forward.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The BMW Group's Leipzig and Spartanburg plants have already been using transport vehicles powered by renewably produced hydrogen for a number of years.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In November 2020, the BMW Group gave the public its first preview of the BMW iX, the first of which are scheduled for delivery to customers in the course of 2021.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Right from the start, the BMW iX was designed exclusively to provide electric mobility that is suitable for everyday use.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The vehicle is powered by the fifth generation of BMW eDrive technology, which the BMW Group has developed in-house and consists of twin electric motors, power electronics, charging technology and a high-voltage battery produced without the use of rare earths.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Fully electric and featuring four-wheel drive technology, it will enable ranges of over 600 km in the WLTP cycle.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Equipped with innovative charging technology and a highly efficient drivetrain, the BMW iX can be charged to enable a range of over 120 km in a mere ten minutes.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Thanks to the development of new technologies, the kidney-shaped grille of the BMW iX has now been given a new function as a smart surface where camera technology, radar and other sensor-based features are located behind a transparent exterior.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In the Financial Services segment, the risk management process also takes financial regulatory requirements such as Basel III into account.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Internal methods for identifying, measuring, managing and monitoring risks within the Financial Services segment comply with national and international standards.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Risk management within the Financial Services business is built on the prevailing risk culture, the defined risk strategy, the internal capital adequacy assessment process framework and a set of rules comprising principles and guidelines.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In organisational terms, the risk management process is ensured by means of a clear division between frontand back-office activities and a comprehensive internal control system.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The main tool used to manage risk within the Financial Services segment is to ensure the segment's risk-bearing capacity.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: All risks -in the sense of unexpected losses -must be covered at all times.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Based on the entity's risk appetite, this is achieved by ensuring specified levels of risk-covering assets (asset cushions) in the form of equity capital.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Unexpected losses are measured using various value-at-risk models, which are validated at regular intervals.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Risks are also aggregated after taking account of correlation effects.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In addition to assessing the Group's ability to bear risk, stress scenarios are also examined.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The segment's risk-bearing capacity is also regularly monitored by means of an integrated limit system for the various risk categories.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Sustainability has developed into a megatrend of our time and is increasingly becoming the focus of political and social debate.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Both the effects of climate change and the changes brought about by the fight against climate change are also likely to be reflected across the world's financial system.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Due to the potential macroeconomic consequences, the related sustainability risks are seen as a threat to the stability of financial markets.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In the context of bank supervision at national and international level, it is therefore essential that the banks concerned take sustainability risks adequately into account.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The Financial Services segment not only helps its customers to satisfy their mobility needs by offering credit financing and leasing products, it also promotes the BMW Group's industrial business from a sales point of view.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The far-reaching consequences of the debate on sustainability and sustainability risks affect both the non-financial economy (and therefore the BMW Group) and the financial economy (and therefore the Financial Services segment).

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Due to the close interrelationships within the Group, developments that affect the BMW Group's industrial business in the first step (e. g. diesel driving bans, adjustments to carbon emissions targets, the growing proportion of e-vehicles, etc.) are also relevant for the Financial Services segment in the second step.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: This environment has always been part of the underlying framework of the Financial Services segment's business model.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The growing challenges posed by climate change and the resulting impact on the financial system are taken into account in the Financial Services segment by adequately addressing sustainability risks.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: As an integral part of the BMW Group's value chain, the Financial Services segment is highly aware of the importance of managing sustainability risks and is therefore fully integrated in the BMW Group's comprehensive sustainable corporate strategy.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The following overview provides a general summary of the main risks and opportunities in the Financial Services segment:

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Risks and opportunities relating to the Financial Services segment

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The main categories of risk relevant for the Financial Services segment are credit and counterparty risk, residual value risk, interest rate risk, operational risk and liquidity risk.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The evaluation of liquidity risk for the Financial Services segment is included in the liquidity risk category for the Group as a whole.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: During the financial year 2020, the aggregate risk cushion for risks in the Financial Services segment was sufficient at all times, thereby ensuring the segment's risk-bearing capacity.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Credit and counterparty risks and opportunities relating to the Financial Services segment

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Credit and counterparty default risk arises within the Financial Services segment if a contractual partner (e. g. a customer or dealership) becomes either unable or only partially able to fulfil its contractual obligations, so that lower income is generated or losses are incurred.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: If unexpected credit and counterparty default risks were to materialise, they could have a medium earnings impact over the two-year assessment period.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The risk amount is classified as medium.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The BMW Group classifies potential opportunities in this area as insignificant.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In light of the uncertainties surrounding the future course of the coronavirus pandemic, additional credit loss provisions were recognised during the financial year 2020 for expected credit losses, in order to reflect the possible negative impact of the coronavirus pandemic on retail customer and dealership business for accounting purposes.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Initial and continuous creditworthiness testing is an important aspect of the BMW Group's credit risk management system.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: For this reason, every borrower's creditworthiness is tested for all credit financing and leasing contracts entered into by the BMW Group.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Opportunities may arise if the managed portfolio performs better over time than estimated when the credits were granted.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The intensive management of purchasing processes and collateral assessment as well as favourable macroeconomic developments could accentuate these opportunities.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In the case of retail customer financing, creditworthiness is assessed using validated scoring systems integrated in the purchasing process.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In the area of dealership financing, creditworthiness is assessed by means of ongoing credit monitoring and an internal rating system that takes account not only of the material credit standing of the borrower, but also of qualitative factors such as past reliability in business relationships.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Changes in the creditworthiness of customers arising during the credit term are covered by risk provisioning procedures.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The credit risk of individual customers is quantified on a monthly basis and, depending on the outcome, taken into account within the risk provisioning system.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Macroeconomic developments are currently subject to a higher degree of volatility.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: If developments are more favourable than assumed in the outlook, credit losses may be reduced, leading to a positive earnings impact.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Due to the coronavirus pandemic, moratoria were granted to customers and dealers, particularly during the first six months of the year, taking into account the prevailing legal requirements.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The simultaneous improvement in the economic situation in most markets in the second half of the year meant that the low percentage of actual loan defaults was kept stable.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Residual value risks and opportunities relating to the Financial Services segment

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Risks and opportunities arise in conjunction with leasing contracts if the market value of a leased vehicle at the end of the contractual term of a lease differs from the residual value estimated at the commencement date of the lease.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: A residual value risk exists if the expected market value of the vehicle at the end of the contractual term is lower than its estimated residual value at the date the contract is entered into.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: If unexpected residual value risks were to materialise, they could have a high earnings impact from the Group's perspective over the two-year assessment period.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: A high earnings impact would then arise for the affected Financial Services and Automotive segments.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The risk amount is classified as high for the Group as a whole.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Opportunities can arise out of a positive deviation between the actual market value and the original residual value forecast.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The BMW Group classifies potential residual value opportunities as significant.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In 2020, the number of electrified vehicles also continued to increase.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Changes in the value of these vehicles are largely determined by a set of known influencing factors.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Market developments are monitored throughout the contractual period and the risk assessment updated accordingly.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Residual value risk management essentially follows the same established process, regardless of the drivetrain variant.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Based on current expectations of a rising level of residual value losses in subsequent years, the level of risk provisioning has been raised in the form of additional provisions and in line with applicable financial reporting standards.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Accordingly, risk costs for residual value risks in the Financial Services segment are significantly higher than one year earlier.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Interest rate risks and opportunities relating to the Financial Services segment

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Interest rate risks in the Financial Services segment relate to potential losses caused by changes in market interest rates.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: These can arise when fixed interest rate periods do not match for assets and liabilities recognised in the balance sheet.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: If interest rate risks were to materialise, they could have a medium earnings impact over the two-year assessment period.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The risk amount is classified as medium.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Favourable interest rate developments compared to the outlook represent opportunities that the BMW Group classifies as significant.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Interest rate risks in the Financial Services business are managed by ensuring that fixed interest rate periods match to a large extent and through the use of interest-rate derivatives.

SENTENCE: In the Financial Services segment, operational risks are defined as the risk of losses arising as a consequence of the unsuitability or failure of internal procedures (process risks), people (personnel-related risks), systems (infrastructure-and IT-related risks) and external events (external risks).

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The recording and measurement of risk scenarios, loss events and countermeasures in the operational risk management system provide the basis for the systematic analysis and management of potential or materialised operational risks.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Annual self-assessments are also carried out.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: INTERNAL CONTROL SYSTEM RELEVANT FOR ACCOUNTING AND FINANCIAL REPORT-ING PROCESSES

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The internal control system relevant for accounting and financial reporting processes has the task of ensuring that accounting and financial reporting of the BMW Group is both accurate and reliable.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Within the framework of the "Three Lines of Defence" model used to manage risk across the Group, the internal control system represents a key component of the second line of defence, serving as a link between the operating units, the corporate audit function and the external auditors.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Internationally recognised standards for internal control systems were taken into account when designing the various components of the BMW Group's internal control system.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The system comprises:

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: -Group-wide mandatory accounting guidelines -Controls integrated in processes and IT systems -Organisational measures incorporating the principles of the risk-oriented segregation of duties -Process-independent monitoring measures The system and the methodologies applied are subject to continuous improvement, with system effectiveness assessed regularly on the basis of centralised and decentralised process analyses, analyses of data within the various financial systems and audit procedures.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The principal features of the internal control system, as far as they relate to individual entity and Group accounting and financial reporting processes, are described below.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Guidelines for recognising, measuring and allocating items to accounts are available to all Group employees via the intranet.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: New accounting standards are assessed for their impact on the BMW Group's accounting and financial reporting.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Accounting guidelines and processes are reviewed continuously and revised at least once a year, or more frequently if required.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Preventive and detective controls are integrated in Group accounting and financial reporting processes.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Preventive controls serve to prevent errors and omissions, whereas detective controls serve to detect and correct errors.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: To the extent possible, they are designed to comply with the principle of the segregation of duties.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Key IT systems that are relevant for accounting and financial reporting incorporate controls designed, among other things, to prevent business transactions from being recorded incorrectly as well as to ensure the timely recognition and measurement of all business transactions in accordance with applicable requirements.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Controls are also in place to test the appropriateness of consolidation procedures.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In conjunction with the ongoing development of IT systems relevant for accounting and financial reporting processes at both individual entity and Group level, controls are adapted to take account of new requirements and opportunities arising as a result of advances in information technology.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Moreover, the BMW Group uses data analysis tools to identify and subsequently eliminate any weaknesses in the control system.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Responsibilities for ensuring the effectiveness of the internal control system in Group accounting and financial reporting processes are clearly defined and allocated to the relevant line and process managers.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: These managers report annually on their assessment of the effectiveness of the internal control system for accounting and financial reporting purposes.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The assessment also includes the results of internal and external audits as well as of data analysis that is conducted on a continual basis.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In this context, the Group's various units confirm the effectiveness of the internal control system for accounting and financial reporting.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The results of the assessment are gathered and documented with the aid of appropriate tools.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Any weaknesses in the control system are eliminated, taking into account their potential impact on accounting and financial reporting processes.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The Board of Management and the Audit Committee are briefed annually on the effectiveness of the internal control system for accounting and financial reporting.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The Board of Management and, where appropriate, the Supervisory Board, are informed without delay if there are any significant changes in the effectiveness of the internal control system.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In August 2020, the IASB published the Amendment Standard Interest Rate Benchmark Reform (IBOR) -Phase 2.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The amendments contain a number of reliefs to mitigate the impact on the accounting treatment of hedge relationships, financial instruments and lease liabilities resulting from the reform of interest rate benchmarks.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Replacing a previous benchmark rate results in a change in the basis for determining the contractual cash flows relating to financial assets and financial liabilities.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: For simplification purposes, it is permitted to account for the change by updating the effective interest rate without any immediate impact on profit or loss.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: This practical expedient is also available for finance leases, in that the requirements contained in IFRS 9 for modifications are deemed to apply.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: A similar practical expedient is available for lease liabilities accounted for in accordance with IFRS 16.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In this case, any modification required by the benchmark reform results only in the lease liability being remeasured when the alternative interest rate is used to discount the modified lease payments.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The amendments are mandatory for financial years beginning on or after 1 January 2021.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The BMW Group intends to apply the proposed practical expedients for transactions affected by the benchmark reform.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The amendments have not been adopted early for the financial year 2020.
