SENTENCE: Other financial reporting standards issued by the IASB and not yet applied are not expected to have any significant impact on the BMW Group Financial Statements.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: ACCOUNTING POLICIES, ASSUMPTIONS, JUDGEMENTS AND ESTIMATIONS

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Revenues from customer contracts include in particular revenues from the sale of products (primarily new and pre-owned vehicles and related products) as well as revenues from services.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Revenue is recognised when control is transferred to the dealership or retail customer.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In the case of sales of products, this is usually at the point in time when the risks and rewards of ownership are transferred.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Revenues are stated net of settlement discount, bonuses and rebates as well as interest and residual value subsidies.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The consideration arising from these sales usually falls due for payment immediately or within 30 days.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In exceptional cases, a longer payment may also be agreed.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In the case of services, control is transferred over time.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Consideration for the rendering of services to customers usually falls due for payment at the beginning of a contract and is therefore deferred as a contract liability.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The deferred amount is released over the service period and recognised as revenue in the income statement.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: As a rule, amounts are released on the basis of the expected expense trend, as this best reflects the performance of the service.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: If the sale of products includes a determinable amount for services (multiple-component contracts), the related revenues are deferred and recognised as income in the same way.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Variable consideration components, such as bonuses, are measured at the expected value, and in the case of multi-component contracts, allocated to all performance obligations unless directly attributable to the sale of a vehicle.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Revenues from the sale of products, for which repurchase arrangements are in place, are not recognised immediately in full.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Instead, revenues are either recognised proportionately or the difference between the sales and repurchase price recognised in instalments over the term of the contract depending on the nature of the agreement.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In the case of vehicles sold to a dealership that are expected to be repurchased in a subsequent period as part of leasing operations, revenues are not recognised at Group level at the time of the sale of the vehicle.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Instead, assets and liabilities relating to the right of return vehicles are recognised.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Revenues from leases of own-manufactured vehicles are recognised at Group level in accordance with the requirements for manufacturer or dealer leases.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In the case of operating leases, revenues from lease payments are recognised on a straight-line basis over the lease term.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In the case of finance leases, revenues are recognised at the lease commencement date at the amount of the fair value of the leased asset and reduced by any unguaranteed residual value of vehicles that are expected to be returned to the Group at the end of the lease term.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Similarly, cost of sales is reduced for unguaranteed residual values.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In addition, initial direct costs are recognised as cost of sales at the lease commencement date.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Earnings per share are calculated as follows: Basic earnings per share are calculated for common and preferred stock by dividing the net profit for the year after minority interests and attributable to each category of stock, by the average number of outstanding shares.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Net profit for the year is accordingly allocated to the different categories of stock.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The portion of the net profit that is not being distributed is allocated to each category of stock based on the number of outstanding shares.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Profits available for distribution are determined directly on the basis of the dividend proposals or resolutions for common and preferred stock.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Diluted earnings per share are calculated and separately disclosed in accordance with IAS 33.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Intangible assets are measured at acquisition or manufacturing cost.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Intangible assets with finite useful lives are amortised on a straight-line basis over their useful lives of between three and 20 years.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Impairment losses are recognised where necessary.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Intangible assets with indefinite useful lives are tested annually for impairment.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Internally generated intangible assets mainly comprise development costs for vehicle, module and architecture projects.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Goodwill arises on first-time consolidation of an acquired business when the cost of acquisition exceeds the Group's share of the net fair value of the assets, liabilities and contingent liabilities identified during the acquisition.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Intangible assets also include emission allowances and similar rights arising from programmes aimed at reducing carbon or other climate-damaging emissions (for example in conjunction with the EU Emissions Trading System or vehicle-related emissions regulations in the USA or China).

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: These allowances and rights are carried at cost and, in the event that they are allocated free of charge, recorded at a value of zero.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Amounts are derecognised at the date of the return, sale or expiry of the allowances or rights.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In parallel to the recognition of these allowances and rights as assets, provisions are recognised in accordance with IAS 37 corresponding to the amount of obligations expected to arise in conjunction with the related emission regulations.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Provisions are measured on the basis of the expected value of the allowances or rights that are to be returned.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: If there is any indication of impairment of intangible assets, or if an annual impairment test is required (i. e. intangible assets with an indefinite useful life, intangible assets during the development phase and goodwill), an impairment test is performed.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Each individual asset is tested separately unless the cash flows generated by the asset are not sufficiently independent from the cash flows generated by other assets or other groups of assets.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In these cases, impairment is tested at the level of a cash-generating unit, which is the norm for the BMW Group.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: For the purpose of the impairment test, the carrying amount of an asset (or a cash-generating unit) is compared with the recoverable amount.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The first step of the impairment test is to determine the value in use.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: If the value in use is lower than the carrying amount, the next step is to determine the fair value less costs to sell and compare the amount so determined with the asset's carrying amount.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: If the fair value is lower than the carrying amount, an impairment loss is recognised, reducing the carrying amount to the higher of the asset's value in use or fair value less costs to sell.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: If the reason for a previously recognised impairment loss no longer exists, the impairment loss is reversed up to the level of the recoverable amount, but no higher than the amortised acquisition or manufacturing cost.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Impairment losses on goodwill are not reversed.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The BMW Group determines the value in use on the basis of a present value computation.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Cash flows used for this calculation are derived from long-term forecasts approved by management.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: These long-term forecasts are based on detailed forecasts drawn up at an operational level, covering a planning period of six years.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: For the purposes of calculating cash flows beyond the planning period, a perpetual annuity return is assumed which does not take growth into account.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Forecasting assumptions are continually adjusted to current information and regularly compared with external sources.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The assumptions used take account in particular of expectations of the profitability of the product portfolio, future market share development, macroeconomic developments (such as currency, interest rate and raw materials prices) as well as the legal environment and past experience.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Amounts are discounted on the basis of a market-related cost of capital rate.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Impairment tests are performed for accounting and financial reporting purposes for the Automotive and Motorcycles cash-generating units using a risk-adjusted pre-tax cost of capital (WACC).

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In the case of the Financial Services cash-generating unit, a pre-tax cost of equity capital is used, as is customary in the sector.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The following discount factors were applied:

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The risk-adjusted discount rate, calculated using a CAPM model, also takes into account specific peer-group information relating to beta-factors, capital structure data and borrowing costs.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In conjunction with the impairment tests for cash-generating units, sensitivity analyses are performed for the main assumptions in order to rule out that possible changes to the assumptions used to determine the recoverable amount would result in the requirement to recognise an impairment loss.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Even in the case of a 10 % deterioration in the individual measurement assumptions, the need to recognise an impairment loss did not arise.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: All items of property, plant and equipment are measured at acquisition or manufacturing cost less accumulated depreciation and accumulated impairment losses.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The cost of internally constructed plant and equipment comprises all costs which are directly attributable to the manufacturing process as well as an appropriate proportion of production-related overheads.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: This includes production-related depreciation and amortisation as well as an appropriate proportion of administrative and social costs.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Financing costs are not included in acquisition or manufacturing cost unless they are directly attributable to the asset.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The carrying amount of items of depreciable property, plant and equipment is written down according to scheduled usage-based depreciation -as a general rule on a straight-line basis -over the useful lives of the assets.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Depreciation is recorded as an expense in the income statement.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The following useful lives are applied throughout the BMW Group:

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: For machinery used in multiple-shift operations, depreciation rates are increased to account for the additional utilisation.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: If there is any indication of impairment of property, plant and equipment, an impairment test is performed as described above for intangible assets.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In the case of leased items of property, plant and equipment, a right-of-use asset and a liability for the outstanding lease payments are recognised with effect from the date on which the leased asset becomes available for use by the BMW Group.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The acquisition cost for the right-of-use asset is calculated as the sum of the present value of the future lease payments, any lease payments made at or before the commencement date, any initial direct costs incurred by the lessee and the estimated costs of dismantling, removing or restoring the leased asset.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Lease incentives granted by the lessor are deducted.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Right-of-use assets are depreciated on a straight-line basis over the shorter of the useful life of the leased asset and the expected lease term.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: If ownership of the leased asset is automatically transferred at the end of the lease term or the exercise of a purchase option is reflected in the lease payments, the right-of-use asset is amortised on a straight-line basis over the expected useful life of the leased asset.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Right-of-use assets are reported in the balance sheet within the relevant line items for property, plant and equipment.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The amortisation expense on rightof-use assets is reported in the income statement in cost of sales as well as in selling and administrative expenses.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The lease liability is measured on initial recognition at the present value of the future lease payments.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Subsequent to initial recognition, the carrying amount of the lease liability is increased to reflect interest on the lease liability and reduced, without income statement impact, by the lease payments made.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Lease liabilities are reported within financial liabilities, while interest expense is reported as part of net interest result.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In the cash flow statement, both the repayment portion and the interest portion of lease payments are shown as cash outflows from financing activities.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The lease payments to be taken into account to measure the right-of-use asset and the lease liability comprise fixed payments, variable lease payments that depend on an index or an interest rate as well as amounts expected to be payable under residual value guarantees.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: If it is reasonably certain that a purchase or lease extension option will be exercised, the relevant payments are also included.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Payments for periods for which the lessee has an option to terminate a lease unilaterally are only included in the lease payments if it is reasonably certain that the termination option will not be exercised.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: For the purposes of assessing options, the BMW Group takes account of all facts and circumstances that create an economic incentive to exercise or not to exercise the option.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: IFRS 16 requires that lease payments are discounted as a general rule using the interest rate implicit in the lease.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: However, since the interest rate in leases entered into by the BMW Group cannot readily be determined, amounts are discounted on the basis of the incremental borrowing rate, comprising the risk-free interest rate in the relevant currency for matching maturities plus a premium for the credit risk.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Specific risks attached to an asset are generally not taken into account, given that collateral received in the context of alternative financing arrangements is not relevant within the BMW Group.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: As lessee, the BMW Group makes use of the application exemptions available for short-term leases and leases of low-value assets.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The BMW Group has not applied the exemptions available to lessees to account for COVID-19-related rent concessions (amendment to IFRS 16 dated 28 May 2020).

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Group products recognised by BMW Group entities as leased products under operating leases are measured at manufacturing cost and all other leased products at acquisition cost, in each case including initial direct costs.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: All leased products are depreciated over the period of the lease using the straight-line method down to their expected residual value.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Where the recoverable amount of a lease exceeds the asset's carrying amount, changes in residual value expectations are recognised by adjusting scheduled depreciation prospectively over the remaining term of the lease.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: If the recoverable amount is lower than the asset's carrying amount, an impairment loss is recognised for the shortfall.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: A test is carried out at each balance sheet date to determine whether an impairment loss recognised in prior years no longer exists or has decreased.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In such cases, the carrying amount of the asset is increased to the recoverable amount, at a maximum up to the amount of the asset's amortised cost.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Investments accounted for using the equity method are measured -provided no impairment has been recognised -at cost of investment adjusted for the Group's share of earnings and changes in equity capital.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: If there is any indication that an investment is impaired, an impairment test is performed on the basis of a discounted cash flow method.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: An indicator exists, for example, in the event of a serious shortfall compared to budget, the loss of an active market or if funds are required to avoid insolvency.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: With the exception of lease receivables, financial assets are measured on initial recognition at their fair value.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Financial assets include in particular other investments, receivables from sales financing, marketable securities and investment funds, derivative financial assets, trade receivables and cash and cash equivalents.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: As a general rule, initial recognition takes place as soon as the BMW Group becomes a party to a contract; in the case of standard purchases or sales of non-derivative financial assets, initial recognition takes place at the settlement date.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Depending on the business model and the structure of contractual cash flows, financial assets are classified as measured at amortised cost, at fair value through comprehensive income or at fair value through profit or loss.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The category "measured at fair value through comprehensive income" at the BMW Group comprises mainly marketable securities and investment funds used for liquidity management purposes.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Selected marketable securities and investment funds, money market funds within cash and cash equivalents as well as convertible bonds are recognised at fair value through profit or loss, as their contractual cash flows do not solely represent payments of principal and interest.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The BMW Group does not make use of the option to measure equity instruments at fair value through other comprehensive income or debt instruments at fair value through profit or loss.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Items reported under other investments within the scope of IFRS 9 are measured at fair value through profit or loss.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Investments in subsidiaries, joint arrangements and associated companies that are not material to the BMW Group are also included in other investments.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: With the exception of receivables from operating leases and trade receivables, the BMW Group applies the general approach described in IFRS 9 to determine impairment of financial assets.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Under the general approach, loss allowances are measured on initial recognition on the basis of the expected 12-month credit loss (stage 1).

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: If the credit loss risk at the end of the reporting period has increased significantly since initial recognition, the impairment allowance is measured on the basis of lifetime expected credit losses (stage 2 -general approach).

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The measurement of the change in default risk is based on a comparison of the default risk at the date of initial recognition and at the end of the reporting period.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The default risk at the end of each reporting period is determined on the basis of credit checks, current key performance indicators and any overdue payments.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The BMW Group applies the simplified approach described in IFRS 9 to operating lease and trade receivables, whereby the amount of the loss allowance is measured subsequent to the initial recognition of the receivable on the basis of lifetime expected credit losses (stage 2simplified approach).

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: For the purposes of allocating at item to stage 2, it is irrelevant whether the credit risk of the assets concerned has increased significantly since initial recognition.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: As a general rule, the BMW Group assumes that a receivable is in default if it is more than 90 days overdue or if there are objective indications of insolvency, such as the opening of insolvency proceedings.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Credit-impaired assets are identified as such on the basis of this definition of default.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In the case of credit-impaired assets which had not been credit-impaired at the time they were acquired or originated, an impairment allowance is recognised at an amount equal to lifetime expected credit losses (stage 3).

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: This is the case regardless of whether the general or simplified approach is applied.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In the case of stage 3 assets, interest income is calculated on the asset's carrying amount less any impairment loss.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The BMW Group derecognises financial assets when it has no reasonable expectation of recovery.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: This may be the case, for instance, if the debtor is deemed not to have sufficient assets or other sources of income to service the debt.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Loss allowances on trade receivables are determined primarily on the basis of information relating to overdue amounts.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Input factors available on the market, such as ratings and probabilities of default, are used to calculate valuation allowance for cash and cash equivalents, financial receivables, receivables from subsidiaries and receivables from companies in which an investment is held.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In the case of marketable securities and investment funds, the BMW Group usually applies the option not to allocate financial assets with a low default risk to different stages.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Accordingly, assets with an investment grade rating are always allocated to stage 1.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Expected credit losses are only presented separately if they are material for the BMW Group Financial Statements.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Derivative financial instruments are used within the BMW Group for hedging purposes in order to reduce currency, interest rate, fair value and market price risks.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Derivative financial instruments are recognised as of the trade date, measured at their fair value.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Depending on their market value at measurement date, these financial instruments are reported in the balance sheet as financial assets or financial liabilities.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Fair values are determined on the basis of valuation models.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Observable market price, tenor and currency basis spreads are taken into account in the measurement of derivative financial instruments.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Furthermore, the Group's own credit risk and that of counterparties is taken into account on the basis of credit default swap values for market contracts with matching terms.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The BMW Group applies the option to recognise the credit risks arising from the fair values of a group of derivative financial assets and liabilities on the basis of their total net amount.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Portfolio-based valuation adjustments (credit valuation adjustments and debit valuation adjustments) to the individual derivative financial assets and financial liabilities are allocated using the relative fair value approach (net method).

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In addition, for selected fixed-interest assets, a portion of the interest rate risk is hedged on a portfolio basis in accordance with IAS 39.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The designated hedged items (underlying transactions) are reported in the balance sheet as receivables from sales financing and financial liabilities.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In this case, swaps are used as the hedging instrument.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Hedge relationships are terminated and redesignated on a monthly basis at the end of each reporting period, thereby taking account of the constantly changing content of each portfolio.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The time values of option transactions and the interest component -including the currency basis -of forward currency contracts are not designated as part of the hedging relationship in the case of currency hedges accounted for as cash flow hedges.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Changes in the fair value of such components are recorded as costs of hedging on a separate line within accumulated other equity.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Amounts recorded in accumulated other equity from currency hedges are reclassified to cost of sales when the related hedged item is recognised in profit or loss.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In the case of raw materials hedges that are accounted for as cash flow hedges, the hedging instruments are designated in full as part of the hedging relationship.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: As an exception to this general rule, the interest component of raw materials derivative instruments redesignated in conjunction with the first-time application of IFRS 9 was not designated as part of the hedging relationship.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Changes in the fair value of this component are recorded as costs of hedging on a separate line within accumulated other equity.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Amounts recorded in accumulated other equity are included in the carrying amount of inventories on initial recognition.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The recoverability of deferred tax assets is assessed at each balance sheet date on the basis of planned taxable income in future financial years.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: If with a probability of more than 50 percent future tax benefits will not be realised, either in part or in total, a valuation allowance is recognised on the deferred tax assets.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The calculation of deferred tax assets requires assumptions to be made with regard to the level of future taxable income and the timing of recovery of deferred tax assets.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: These assumptions take account of forecast operating results and the impact on earnings of the reversal of taxable temporary differences.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Since future business developments cannot be predicted with certainty and to some extent cannot be influenced by the BMW Group, the measurement of deferred tax assets is subject to uncertainty.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Deferred tax liabilities on taxable temporary differences arising from investments in subsidiaries, branches and associated companies as well as interests in joint arrangements are not recognised if the Group is able to control the timing of the reversal and it is probable that the temporary difference will not reverse in the foreseeable future.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: This is particularly the case if it is intended that profits will not be distributed, but rather will be used to maintain the substance and expand the volume of business of the entities concerned.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Current income taxes are calculated within the BMW Group on the basis of tax legislation applicable in the relevant countries.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: To the extent that judgement was necessary to determine the treatment and amount of tax items presented in the financial statements, there is in principle a possibility that local tax authorities may take a different position.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: As a general rule, each income tax treatment is considered independently when accounting for uncertainties in income taxes.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: If it is not considered probable that an income tax treatment will be accepted by the local tax authorities, the BMW Group uses the most likely amount of the tax treatment when determining taxable profit and the tax base.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Work in progress and finished goods, as well as vehicles held for sale in the financial services business, are stated at the lower of manufacturing cost and net realisable value.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Manufacturing cost comprises all costs which are directly attributable to the manufacturing process as well as an appropriate proportion of production-related overheads.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: This includes production-related depreciation and amortisation and an appropriate proportion of administrative and social costs.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Financing costs are not included in the acquisition or manufacturing cost of inventories.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Cash and cash equivalents comprise mainly cash on hand and cash at bank with an original term of up to three months.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: With the exception of money market funds, cash and cash equivalents are measured at amortised cost.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Financial liabilities, with the exception of lease liabilities, are measured on first-time recognition at their fair value.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: For these purposes, transaction costs are taken into account except in the case of financial liabilities allocated to the category "measured at fair value through profit or loss".

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Subsequent to initial recognition, liabilities are -with the exception of derivative financial instruments -measured at amortised cost using the effective interest method.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In the case of funded plans, the pension obligation is offset against plan assets measured at their fair value.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: If the plan assets exceed the pension obligation, the surplus is tested for recoverability.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In the event that the BMW Group has a right of reimbursement or a right to reduce future contributions, it reports an asset (within Other financial assets), measured on the basis of the present value of the future economic benefits attached to the plan assets.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: For funded plans, in cases where the obligation exceeds plan assets, a liability is recognised under pension provisions.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The calculation of the amount of the provision requires assumptions to be made with regard to discount rates, salary trends, employee fluctuation and the life expectancy of employees.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Discount rates are determined by reference to market yields at the end of the reporting period on high quality fixed-interest corporate bonds.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The salary trend relates to the expected future rate of salary increase which is estimated annually based on inflation and the career development of employees within the Group.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Past service cost arises where a BMW Group company introduces a defined benefit plan or changes the benefits payable under an existing plan.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: This cost is recognised immediately in the income statement.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Similarly, gains and losses arising on the settlement of a defined benefit plan are recognised immediately in the income statement.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Other provisions are recognised when the BMW Group has a present legal or factual obligation towards a third party arising from past events, the settlement of which is probable, and when the amount of the obligation can be reliably estimated.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Provisions with a remaining period of more than one year are measured at their net present value.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The measurement of provisions for statutory and non-statutory warranty obligations (statutory, contractual and voluntary) involves estimations.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In addition to manufacturer warranties prescribed by law, the BMW Group offers various further standard (assurancetype) warranties depending on the product and sales market.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: No provisions are recognised for additionally offered service packages that are treated as separate performance obligations.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Provisions for statutory and non-statutory warranties are recognised at the point in time when control over the goods is transferred to the dealership or retail customer or when it is decided to introduce new warranty measures.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: With respect to the level of the provision, estimations are made in particular based on past experience of damage claims and processes.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Future potential repair costs and price increases per product and market are also taken into account.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Provisions for warranties for all companies of the BMW Group are adjusted regularly to take account of new information, with the impact of any changes recognised in the income statement.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Further information is provided in note 33.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Similar estimates are also made in conjunction with the measurement of expected reimbursement claims.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Related party disclosures comprise information on associated companies, joint ventures and non-consolidated subsidiaries as well as individuals which have the ability to exercise a controlling or significant influence over the financial and operating policies of the BMW Group.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: This includes all persons in key positions of the Company, as well as close members of their families or intermediary entities.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In the case of the BMW Group, this also applies to members of the Board of Management and the Supervisory Board.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Details relating to these individuals and entities are provided in note 40 and in the list of investments disclosed in note 46.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Share-based remuneration programmes which are expected to be settled in shares are measured at their fair value at grant date.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The related expense is recognised as personnel expense in the income statement over the vesting period and offset against capital reserves.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Sharebased remuneration programmes expected to be settled in cash are revalued to their fair value at each balance sheet date between the grant date and the settlement date and on the settlement date itself.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The expense is recognised as personnel expense in the income statement over the vesting period and presented in the balance sheet as a provision.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The share-based remuneration programme for Board of Management members and senior heads of department entitles BMW AG to elect whether to settle its commitments in cash or with shares of BMW AG common stock.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Based on the decision to settle in cash, the share-based remuneration programmes for Board of Management members and senior heads of department are accounted for as cash-settled, share-based remuneration programmes.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Further information on share-based remuneration programmes is provided in note 41.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The BMW Group's earnings for the financial year 2020 have been negatively impacted by the course of the coronavirus pandemic and the related measures put in place to contain the virus.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Whereas the main negative factors in the first quarter were the drop in demand in China and the closure of dealerships in a few other markets, business in the second quarter was adversely impacted by the global spread of the pandemic affecting other key sales markets of the BMW Group.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Although customer demand increased in many markets during the second half of the year, the repercussions of the coronavirus pandemic on business in the first half of the year continued to be felt.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: This is reflected in particular in the decline in revenues, mainly due to the lower number of vehicle sales and lower revenues from spare parts.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The decline in vehicle sales was also reflected in cost of sales, whereby fixed costs fell on a less pronounced scale by comparison to the reduction in capacity utilisation levels.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Group earnings were also negatively impacted by higher risk provisioning expenses relating in particular to the reassessment of residual value and credit risks.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Due to lower new leasing business as well as lower expected new leasing business, the amount of revenues eliminated on consolidation fell compared to the previous year.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In light of the developments described above, Group net profit was significantly lower than in the previous year.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Significant effects on the Group Financial Statements are described below.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The increasing global spread of the coronavirus and the related low market capitalisation of BMW AG gave rise to an indication that tangible and intangible assets of the BMW Group could be impaired.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: As a result, impairment tests were performed for the Automotive, Motorcycles and Financial Services cash-generating units.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In this context, values in use were determined on the basis of updated long-term forecasts that already reflect adjustments to expectations made in light of coronavirus.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Against this backdrop, it was decided not to include probability-weighted scenarios.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: A detailed description of the methodology applied to perform impairment tests is provided in note 5.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: From the BMW Group's perspective, the spread of coronavirus also provided an indication of impairment relating to investments accounted for using the equity method.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The exception to this general consideration was the BMW Brilliance Automotive joint venture in China, given the rapid economic recovery registered in that region.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Further information is provided in note 24.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In the case of the US market, past experience relevant for market value changes arising during the financial crisis was taken into account in the calculation of post-model adjustments.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In the case of the UK and Canadian markets, the procedures applied also included projections drawn up by external providers on the impact of the coronavirus pandemic.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In all cases, assumptions pertaining to the scale and duration of the pandemic's effects took account of current market value developments.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: If the regression models used were highly affected by market values realised in recent months, the outcomes were adjusted for exceptionally positive results in the second half of the year for instance, in the UK and the Netherlands.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In the case of the Belgian and German markets, for instance, procedures included the derivation of a number of macroeconomic scenarios to calculate the potential impact on pre-owned vehicle valuations.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Probabilities were weighted where necessary, taking into account external indicators (e. g. consumer confidence indices) and internal indicators (e. g. inventory trends).

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In some cases, including for the French market, macroeconomic parameters based on current risk estimates were adjusted.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Discretionary model adjustments are regularly reviewed in order to ensure that allowances for residual value losses are continuously updated on the basis of expected market values.

SENTENCE: Group Financial Statements Notes to the Group Financial Statements BMW Group Report 2020

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Segment information is prepared as a general rule in conformity with the accounting policies adopted for preparing and presenting the Group Financial Statements.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Exceptions to this general principle include the treatment of inter-segment warranties, the earnings impact of which is allocated to the Automotive and Financial Services segments on the basis used internally to manage the business.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In addition, intragroup repurchase agreements between the Automotive and Financial Services segments pursuant to IFRS 15, impairment allowances on intragroup receivables and changes in the value of consolidated other investments pursuant to IFRS 9 are also excluded.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Intragroup leasing arrangements are not reflected in the internal management and reporting system on an IFRS 16 basis and therefore, in accordance with IFRS 8, do not give rise to any changes in the presentation of segment information.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Inter-segment receivables and payables, provisions, income, expenses and profits are eliminated upon consolidation.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Inter-segment revenues are based on market prices.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Centralised functions are included in the segments concerned.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Expenses for centralised administrative functions allocated to the Financial Services segment are not settled in cash.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The role of "chief operating decision maker" with respect to resource allocation and performance assessment of the reportable segment is embodied in the full Board of Management.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: For this purpose, different measures of segment performance as well as segment assets are taken into account in the operating segments.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The Automotive and Motorcycles segments are managed on the basis of return on capital employed (RoCE).

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The relevant measure of segment results used is therefore profit before financial result.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Capital employed is the corresponding measure of segment assets used to determine how to allocate resources and comprises all current and non-current operational assets after deduction of liabilities used operationally which are generally not subject to interest (e. g. trade payables).

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The success of the Financial Services segment is measured on the basis of return on equity (RoE).

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: BMW AG's Supervisory Board is composed of ten shareholder representatives (elected by the Annual General Meeting) and ten employee representatives (elected in accordance with the CoDetermination Act).

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The Supervi sory Board has the task of advising and supervising the Board of Management in its management of BMW AG.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: It is involved in all decisions of fundamental importance for BMW AG.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The Supervisory Board appoints the members of the Board of Management and decides upon the level of remuneration they receive.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The Supervisory Board can revoke appointments for important reasons.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Members of the Supervisory Board of BMW AG are obliged to act in the best interest of the enterprise as a whole.

SENTENCE: They may not pursue personal interests in their decisions or take advantage of business opportunities intended for the benefit of the BMW Group.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Members of the Supervisory Board are obliged to inform the full Supervisory Board of any conflicts of interest so that the latter can report to the shareholders at the Annual General Meeting on its treatment of the issue.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Conflicts of interest requiring to be disclosed in clude, in particular, conflicts of interest that may arise as a result of a consultant or board function with clients, suppliers, lenders or other business partners.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Significant and nontemporary conflicts of interest of a Supervisory Board member result in the termination of mandate.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The Supervisory Board regularly assesses the effi ciency of its activities.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: To this end, shared discussion is conducted within the Supervisory Board and, at regular intervals, in personal discussions with the Chairman, prepared on the basis of a questionnaire sent in advance, which is drawn up by the Supervisory Board.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The Supervisory Board has stated specific targets for its composition, agreed to a diversity concept and deter mined a competency profile.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Members of the Supervisory Board are responsible for undertaking any training re quired for the performance of their duties.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The Company provides them with appropriate assistance therein.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Taking into account the specific circumstances of the BMW Group and the number of Board members, the Supervisory Board has set up a Presiding Board and four committees, namely the Personnel Committee, the Audit Committee, the Nomination Committee and the Media tion Committee.

SENTENCE: These serve to raise the efficiency of the Supervisory Board's work and facilitate the handling of complex issues.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Composition of the Presiding Board and the various committees is based on legal requirements, the Articles of Incorporation, rules of procedure and corporate gov ernance principles, while taking into particular account the expertise of the members concerned.

SENTENCE: Further information on the composition and working procedures of the Supervisory Board and its committees is provided in the Corporate Governance Statement at www.bmwgroup.com/ezu (Corporate Governance).

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The criteria include in particular innovation (econom ic and ecological, for example in the reduction of carbon emissions), the Group's market position compared to its competitors, customer focus, ability to adapt, leadership, corporate culture, promotion of compliance and integrity, contribution to the Group's attractiveness as an employ er, progress in implementing the diversity concept, and activities that foster corporate social responsibility.

SENTENCE: The Supervisory Board also draws comparisons with com petitors.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: 1 Measurement of leased products 1

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The BMW Group leases vehicles to end customers under operating leases (leased products).

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: At the bal ance sheet date, the figure reported under the "leased products" line item for operating leases was EUR 41,995 million (approximately 19.4 % of total assets).

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Leased products are measured at cost, which is de preciated on a straightline basis over the lease term to the expected residual value (recoverable amount).

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: A key estimated value for subsequent measurement of leased products is the expected residual value at the end of the lease term.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The BMW Group uses in ternally available data on historical empirical values, current market data and market estimates as well as forecasts by external market research institutes.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The estimation of future residual values is subject to judgment due to the large number of assumptions to be made by the executive directors and the amount of data included in the determination.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: As part of our audit we obtained an understanding of the development of operating leases, the underlying residual value risks as well as the business processes for the identification, management, monitoring and measurement of residual value risks, among other things by inquiries and inspection of documents related to the internal calculation methods.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Fur thermore, we evaluated the appropriateness and effectiveness of the internal control system, par ticularly regarding the determination of expected residual values.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: This included the evaluation of the propriety of the relevant IT systems as well as the implemented interfaces therein by our IT specialists.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In addition, we evaluated the appropriateness of the forecasting methods, the model assumptions as well as the parameters used for the measurement of the residual values based on the validations carried out by the BMW Group.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: For this purpose, we inquired with the BMW Group's experts responsible for the management and monitoring of residual value risks and inspected the internal analysis on residual value developments and residual value forecasts as well as the validation results.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: We examined the mathemati cally correctness of the forecast values using the key calculation steps.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Based on our audit procedures, we were able to satisfy ourselves that the methods and processes for determining the expected residual values of leased products underlying the valuation are appropriate and the assumptions and parameters included in the forecast model for the residual value are appropriate as a whole.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: 3 The Company's disclosures on the applied "Account ing policies, assumptions, judgments and estimations" are contained in the notes to the consolidated finan cial statements under note 5 and on leased products are contained under note 23.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Impairment losses amounting to EUR 1,639 million were recognized on these receivables as at the balance sheet date.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In order to determine the amount of the necessary valuation allowances to be recognized with respect to receivables from sales financing, the BMW Group, among others, evaluates the creditworthiness of the dealers, importers and end customers, as well as any loss ratios, and risk provisioning parameters are derived based on historical default probabilities and loss ratios.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: As part of our audit we obtained a comprehensive understanding of the development of receivables from sales financing, the associated defaultrelated risks as well as the business processes for the identi fication, management, monitoring and measurement of default risks , among other things by inquiries and inspection of documents on the internal cal culation methods.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Furthermore, we evaluated the appropriateness and effectiveness of the internal control system regarding the determination of the impairment loss to recognize.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In this context, we also evaluated the relevant IT systems and internal pro cesses.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The evaluation included an assessment by our IT specialists of the appropriateness of the systems concerned and associated interfaces to ensure the completeness of data as well as the audit of auto mated controls for data processing.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: As part of our audit we assessed in particular the appropriateness of the risk classification procedures as well as the risk provisioning parameters used.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: For this purpose, we analyzed in particular the validations of parameters that are regularly conducted by the Company.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: To as sess the default risk, we also used targeted sampling of individual cases to examine whether the attributes for assignment to the respective risk categories were suitably available and the impairment losses had been calculated using the parameters defined for these risk categories.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: 3 Valuation of provisions for statutory and non-statutory warranty obligations and product guarantees 1 Provisions for statutory and nonstatutory warranty obligations as well as product guarantees are in cluded in the consolidated financial statements of BMW Group as a material amount in other provi sions.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The obligations amounted to EUR 6,131 mil lion (approximately 2.8 % of total assets) as at De cember 31, 2020.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: BMW Group is responsible for the legally required warranty and product guarantees in the respective sales market.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In order to estimate the liabilities arising from statutory and nonstatutory warranty obligations and product guarantees for vehicles sold, information on the type and volume of damages arising and on remedial measures is recorded and analyzed at vehicle model level.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The expected amount of obligations is extrapolated from costs of the past and recognized as a provision in the corresponding amount, if the criteria of IAS 37 have been met.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: For specific or anticipated individual circumstances, for example recalls, additional provi sions are recognized provided they have not already been taken into account.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The determination of provisions is associated with unavoidable estimation uncertainties and is subject to a high risk of change, depending on factors such as notification of detected defects as well as claims made by vehicle owners.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Against this background, this matter was of particular significance during our audit.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In order to assess the appropriateness of the val uation method used for the determination of the provisions for statutory and nonstatutory warranty obligations as well as product guarantees including the assumptions and parameters, we primarily ob tained an understanding of the process for deter mining the assumptions and parameters through discussions with the responsible employees of the BMW Group.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: We also evaluated the appropriateness as well as effectiveness of controls for determining the assumptions and parameters.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: With the involve ment of our IT specialists, we checked the IT systems used regarding their compliance.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: We compared the expenses for claims and technical actions with ac tual costs incurred in order to draw conclusions on the forecast accuracy.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Based on a targeted sample of vehicle models, the mathematically correctness of the valuation model used across the Group was examined.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: We examined and evaluated the assump tions used by the BMW Group concerning the extent to which the past values were representative of the expected susceptibility of damage, the expected value of damage per vehicle (comprising parts and labor input) as well as the expected assertion of claims from statutory and nonstatutory warranties.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Furthermore, there was a triggering event at the level of the BMW Group.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The Company has identified as a triggering event in particular a significant deviation from target figures and the impacts of the coronavi rus crisis regarding the YOUR NOW equity invest ment.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: As a result of the impairment test performed, no further writedowns were necessary as at balance sheet date.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: As part of our audit, we examined and evaluated the methodological procedure adopted for the purposes of measuring the YOUR NOW equity investment as well as for performing the impairment test, among other things.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: We also assessed the appropriateness of the valuation parameters and assumptions on which the measurement was based.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: We examined the impairment test conducted by the BMW Group based on the occurrence of a triggering event.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: After comparing the future cash inflows used in the calcu lation against the underlying budget, we assessed the appropriateness of the calculation, in particular by reconciling it with general and sectorspecific market expectations.

SENTENCE: Moreover, we evaluated the estimates made by the executive directors with respect to the impacts of the coronavirus crisis on the YOUR NOW equity investment and examined its consideration in the calculation of future cash inflows.

SENTENCE: Measurement of provision for risks relating to an EU antitrust proceeding

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In April 2019, the BMW Group was notified by the European Commission of complaints in a pending antitrust proceeding.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The European Commission accuses various manufacturers of colluding to re strict competition in the field of innovation.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In this connection, as in the previous year, a EUR 1.4 billion provision for litigation and risk provisioning was rec ognized at the balance sheet date in the consolidated financial statements under the balance sheet item "Other provisions".

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The risk assessment to be made on developments in the EU antitrust proceeding and the estimation of whether or not a provision must be recognized to cover the risks, and if so, in what amount the current obligation must be measured, is subject to a high degree of uncertainties and charac terized by the estimates and assumptions made by the executive directors.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In our view, this matter was of particular significance for our audit due to the significant uncertainties con cerning the outcome of the EU antitrust proceeding and the potential effects on BMW AG's assets, liabil ities, financial position and financial performance.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: With the knowledge that estimated values result in an increased risk of accounting misstatements and that the executive directors' recognition and measure ment decisions have a direct effect on consolidated result, we evaluated the retention of the carrying amounts, with the involvement of an internal PwC antitrust law expert.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: Furthermore, we also held reg ular meetings with the Company's legal department in order to receive updates on current developments and the reasons for the corresponding estimates.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: The development of the aforementioned risks arising from the EU antitrust proceeding, including the executive directors' estimates concerning the poten tial proceeding outcomes, was provided to us by the Company in writing.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In addition, we obtained and evaluated an external legal confirmation as at the balance sheet date.

TITLE: BMW-Group-Bericht-2020-EN
SENTENCE: In our view, the estimates made by the executive di rectors regarding the recognition and measurement of the provision for the risks from the EU antitrust proceeding described above and the associated risk provision in the consolidated financial statements are sufficiently documented and substantiated.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: Going forward, we will continue to place this aspect at the center of our activities and cultivate a culture of sustainability within the company.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: Everyone at Bosch can make a contribution -and is explicitly invited to do so.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: Working as a team, we are intent on persevering on our path to greater sustainability and mastering the chal lenges ahead.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: First and foremost, this concerns climate action, an area in which we want to further refine our measures and pursue a comprehensive approach with our scope 3 target.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: But many creative contributions are needed in other areas as well, including in our endeav ors to counter water scarcity, the sustainable design of our supply chains, and the social projects in our communities.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: Our latest factbook makes our commitment to sustain ability transparent and shows you the specific goals we have set ourselves for the coming years.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: Supplemented by spotlights magazine, which highlights selected top ics, we are providing a comprehensive picture of our activities.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: I am delighted that you are accompanying our com pany's journey to even greater sustainability.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: And I look forward to your comments and suggestions regarding our activ ities.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: On that note, I wish you an informative and Rethink and reset -that was the ultimate lesson of the Covid-19 pandemic last year.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: We all had to adapt as fast as we could.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: Climate action is another, equally pressing issue.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: It will take creativity, perseverance, and determination to preserve our planet for future generations.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: We are determined to do our part.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: By making our business operations carbon neutral, we have shown that climate-compatible entrepreneurship is possible -if

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: we are willing to take decisive action.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: The Bosch Group with its more than 400 locations worldwide has not left a carbon footprint since February 2020, making it the first global manufacturing company in the industrial sector to make its operations carbon neutral.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: We received official confirmation to this effect from an independent audit firm in March.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: With the same determination, we are now setting our sights on the next milestones of our climate action strategy.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: But let's be clear: if we want to effectively limit global warming, we have to do more.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: At Bosch, for instance, we are working to minimize the proportion of carbon offsets we need to stay carbon neutral.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: To replace them, we are continuously expanding our measures to enhance energy efficiency and increase the volume of renewable energy generated from new plants.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: With our scope 3 strategy, we are looking beyond our company's boundaries and setting ourselves the goal of reducing the emissions produced by our suppliers, in logistics, and particularly when our products are used.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: Working shoulder to shoulder with our partners throughout the value chain, we aim to cut back these emissions by 15 percent in absolute terms by 2030.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: I am convinced we will succeed here, too.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: Because we, at Bosch, do not see energy efficiency and the reduction of emissions as a threat to our business model but rather as an opportunity to differentiate ourselves from the competition -and we want to persuade the companies we partner with of the truth of this logic.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: A clear manifestation of this thinking, our newly established Bosch Climate Solutions operating unit is sharing our experience reaching carbon neutrality with other companies, thereby multiplying our impact further afield.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: In this way, not only are we paving the way to a climate-neutral economy but also opening up new growth areas for Bosch.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: Our "Invented for life" strategic imperative also encapsulates the promise to devote our deep engineering knowledge to progress, improving quality of life, and protecting the environment.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: We are resolutely committed to the technologies that make a decisive contribution to this end.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: For instance, with investments in the billions, Bosch has been actively driving forward the development of electromobility for years.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: We are also committed to the introduction and expansion of hydrogen applications -from automobiles to heating systems.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: This is an essential step as we progress toward our ambitious climate targets.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: The Bosch Group is a leading global supplier of technol ogy and services.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: It employs roughly 395,000 associates worldwide (as of December 31, 2020) and generated sales revenue of 71.5 billion euros in the 2020 business year (previous year: 77.7 billion euros).

SENTENCE: The Bosch Group comprises Robert Bosch GmbH and its roughly 440 sub sidiaries and regional companies in some 60 countries.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: Including sales and service partners, Bosch's global manufacturing, engineering, and sales network covers nearly every country in the world.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: Bosch improves quality of life worldwide with innova tive products and services that are "Invented for life" and spark enthusiasm.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: As a leading IoT provider, we offer innovative solutions for smart homes, Industry 4.0, and connected mobility.

SENTENCE: Bosch is pursuing a vision of mobility that is sustainable, safe, and exciting.

SENTENCE: We use our expertise in sensor technology, software, and services, as well as our propitiatory IoT cloud, to offer our customers connected, crossdomain solutions from a single source.

SENTENCE: The basis for our company's future growth is our innovative strength.

SENTENCE: In 2020, Bosch invested roughly 5.9 billion euros in research and development.

SENTENCE: This makes Bosch one of the leading automotive suppli ers.

SENTENCE: The Mobility Solutions business sector pursues a vision of mobility that is safe, sustainable, and exciting.

SENTENCE: As an automotive supplier of original equipment, Bosch is engaged in a very wide range of activities that are orga nized into the Powertrain Solutions, Chassis Systems Control, Electrical Drives, Automotive Electronics, and Automotive Steering divisions, as well as the Cross Domain Computing Solutions division, which was estab lished at the beginning of 2021 and with which Bosch is adapting to the changing requirements in the rapidly growing market for softwareintensive electronic systems in the automotive sector.

SENTENCE: In 2020 alone, Bosch made upfront investments of around 500 million euros in electromobility, including fuel cells.

SENTENCE: Bosch is also systematically improving its driver assistance systems for automation levels 1 and 2, working on handsfree high way assist systems, and developing automated driving to SAE levels 3 and 4.

SENTENCE: With intelligent components, cus tomized system solutions, and services, Drive and Con trol Technology creates the necessary environment for applications with full connectivity.

SENTENCE: The division offers its customers hydraulics, electric drives and controls, gear technology, and linear motion and assembly technology, including software and interfaces to the IoT.

SENTENCE: Bosch's provider of assembly systems (primarily for inhouse use), the business unit Robert Bosch Manufac turing Solutions GmbH develops flexible, scalable plans for assembly systems, customized solutions in the field of testing and process technology, and related services.

SENTENCE: Industrial Technology also encompasses the Bosch Con nected Industry business unit.

SENTENCE: With a focus on Industry 4.0, the business unit develops software solutions and carries out projects for internal and external customers.

SENTENCE: From the perspective of the board of management, the Bosch Group came through 2020 well -a year domi nated by the global Covid19 pandemic.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: In the Bosch Group, risk management encompasses the entire company, including all essential operations, functional areas, divisions, regional organizations, and business sectors.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: It is thus a core responsibility for all managers on every level of the Bosch Group.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: As a rule, responsibility for risk management is assumed locally on all group management levels, with certain governance tasks being organized at the corporate level.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: This means that, as far as possible, risks are identified and managed where they arise: in other words, above all in the divi sions and their regional subsidiaries.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: The latter are also primarily responsible for introducing measures to reduce or control risks.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: In addition, corporate departments for areas such as compliance management, legal services, tax, and the corporate office for the risk management system support, direct, and monitor the operating units' control activities.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: Internal auditing, which additionally reports directly to the managing partners of Robert Bosch Industrietreuhand KG, has responsibilities includ ing assessing the appropriateness and effectiveness of the tasks described and, if necessary, proposing that the board of management initiate remedial measures.

SENTENCE: The Bosch Group risk management system takes its lead from the relevant standards: ISO 31000, COSO III (ERM), and IDW AuS 340.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: The main riskmanagement principles include the systematic detection, tracking, and prevention of relevant risks, as well as structures to promote and monitor legally compliant and rulecompli ant conduct.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: In this context, the corporate coordinating office for the risk management system is responsible for making risk management fit for the growing tasks ahead.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook
SENTENCE: This has included the preparation and publica tion of a risk management directive that is valid for the entire Bosch Group.

TITLE: bosch-sustainability-report-2020-factbook

SENTENCE: In certain units, there were delays as a result of the Covid19 pandemic.

SENTENCE: The directive serves to ensure greater clarity regarding basic principles and responsibilities.

TITLE: Continental-2020
SENTENCE: Refurbishment -processing air spring systems Regular maintenance of air spring systems in a rail vehicle is essential to ensure compliance with demanding safety standards.

TITLE: Continental-2020
SENTENCE: However, it does not always have to be a new system.

TITLE: Continental-2020
SENTENCE: Continental's refurbishment service enables the reconditioning of used air spring systems for regional trains, metro trains and other rail vehicles.

TITLE: Continental-2020
SENTENCE: First, the air spring system is dismantled into its individual components, which are then checked for reusability.

TITLE: Continental-2020
SENTENCE: A new air bellows, a new metal-rubber auxiliary spring and the necessary add-on parts are installed onto the parts that are still intact.

TITLE: Continental-2020
SENTENCE: The complete air spring system is then tested on a testing machine with state-of-the-art technology.

TITLE: Continental-2020
SENTENCE: In addition to being a faster and more cost-effective process, the service also reduces the burden on the environment.

TITLE: Continental-2020
SENTENCE: Thanks to professional dismantling, state-of-the-art technology and corresponding expertise, 50 to 100 kg of metal per air spring system can be reused, eliminating the need to dispose of scrap metal or manufacture new steel and aluminum components.

TITLE: Continental-2020
SENTENCE: This reduces CO2 emissions by up to 300 kg per air spring system.

TITLE: Continental-2020
SENTENCE: The prepared parts are tested on the series test bench and meet quality standards.

TITLE: Continental-2020
SENTENCE: The reduction of new part production steps also results in energy savings.

TITLE: Continental-2020
SENTENCE: The process is used, for example, in diesel injector remanufacturing at the Limbach-Oberfrohna location.

SENTENCE: The program was expanded in 2020 and several European OE customers have been supplied with remanufactured diesel injectors.

SENTENCE: Injector bodies are reused and only the nozzle and actuator are replaced with new components.

SENTENCE: Remanufacturing injectors saves up to 61% material and 29% energy compared with new part production.
